course.subject: COMP
course.name: Machine Learning
course.description: Introduction to major learning paradigms and techniques, basic applied statistics and information theory, decision trees, neural networks, Bayesian classification, kernel methods, clustering, density estimation, feature selection and extraction, hidden Markov models, reinforcement learning, case-based learning, model selection and various applications.

reviews.author: xklong
reviews.comment_content: his course encompasses a wide range of machine learning topics, providing you with a comprehensive understanding of the underlying theory. By completing this course, you will acquire a solid foundation in machine learning.
reviews.comment_teaching: Due to the extensive coverage of topics in this course, the teaching pace may be relatively fast.
reviews.comment_grading: The examination for this course is conducted with closed books, meaning you won't have access to external references. However, the exam itself is not overly challenging. By diligently following the guidance of the instructor and thoroughly reviewing the lecture notes, you can expect to achieve a high grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is a little bit heavy. It requires 4 written assignments first. I choose not to present so I have to finish 6 hands-on assignments as well.

reviews.author: PeterGam
reviews.title: Boring class with unclear explaination
reviews.comment_content: At a high level, this course can be splitted into two modules: fundamentals and recent researches. The fundamentals cover some mathematic basics (e.g., derivatives, matrix calculation, probability theory) and why machine learning works from theory level. This part is derived from UCLA CS 260. The other part focuses on recent advances in deep learning (e.g., transformers, GANs, semi-supervised learning).
reviews.comment_teaching: Unsatisfactory. It can be observed that the instructor tries to make things clear. However, most of the time he would waste on the simple concepts and nearly skipped on what's unfamiliar to me (e.g., graph theory). Even some times the instructor receive no response for the question "If someone understands, please raise your hand", leaving an awkward classroom atmosphere.
reviews.comment_grading: I think it is like a binary grading. The final is not difficult. For assignments, as long as you can "complete" them, there will be full marks (since the expected outcome for programming and proofs is obvious), otherwise the marks would be low.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload can also be splitted into two categories. For programming projects, you may Google it or search Github for the original answers (as I've said in the content section, it basically copies UCLA CS260). It contains just some simple prediction algorithms. However, for the written homework, it would cost a lot of efforts to dig into it since it is proofs to some of mathematical concepts with few reference you can refer to.

reviews.author: NotSaitama
reviews.title: Below average teaching and grading
reviews.comment_content: The topics in the syllabus were quite interesting. Few topics covered are Theory of generalisation, SVM, DNN, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: He partially copied his slides from the course by Prof. Yaser (Caltech), but was not very good at explaining them. I also found it hard to understand what he is speaking as he speaks in a very low voice.
reviews.comment_grading:
No consideration was given to whether the student understands the topic, but only whether the answer is ditto copy of what the instructor wishes to see there. Using any other valid definition than what was presented will lead to deduction in marks.  

No explanation is usually given on many assignments like why they deduct marks until you ask explicitly, and even then your request could be ignored indefinitely.

I also found that he himself doesn't understand many concepts, and is extremely hostile toward any sort of discussion about grading.
This was the first course of his career, and I hope he will becomes a better teacher in the future.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload. Few assignments, one project, and one exam. The instructor never told or have any useful feedback on the project proposal, but was very quick to criticize the final report. I would have preferred if he has given some feedback earlier so we can improve.

reviews.author: zhengrui.guo
reviews.comment_content: The contents are quite comprehensive and the instructor covered almost every aspect in Machine Learning.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think the teaching part can be further improved. Dr. Cheng definitely knows what he's talking about but sometimes it's hard to interpret to students. Maybe he can talk louder next time.
reviews.comment_grading: You can definitely get high grade as long as you go through the slides thoroughly and listen to the recordings. The first two assignments are quite challenging since they are all mathematical problems. But the following ones become easier with programming problems.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was fine. There are 5 assignments with mathematical problems and programming problems. Each may take around 2-3 days. There are no midterm. And you need to conduct a machine learning-related project and do the presentation. And there is a final.

reviews.author: hkustcsepg
reviews.comment_content: This course includes valuable information on machine learning topics such as probability, regression, RNN, CNN, Transformer, GAN, VAE, and RL. It is highly beneficial and applicable.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nevin is an excellent teacher, and his courses are straightforward to understand. However, he did mention in the first class that his course is not suitable for students without prior knowledge of machine learning. Nonetheless, I believe it could be beneficial for beginners who are willing to put in the effort to learn.
And I think his website about the course is quite clear for students with a lot of useful information about course info, announcements, course materials and RVC videos.
reviews.comment_grading:
4 Written Assignments: (4x5%)
Projects: (30%)
Final examination: (50%)
I received a score of 5/5 on most of my homework assignments.
My performance on the final exam was close to the average score but a little higher.
That's A-
reviews.comment_workload: I find the workload a bit burdensome. The homework and coding labs require a significant amount of my time almost every week. However, Nevin presented an alternative - an opportunity to work on a machine learning project. Those who choose to take on the team project(2 to 3 students as a team) can avoid completing the ongoing coding labs.

reviews.author: N4Y
reviews.comment_content: This course covers a wide range of topics in Machine Learning. It also introduces new research in the relevant areas. The main focus of the course is the theoretical foundation behind all the ML techniques, which means you need to understand the equations and algorithms thoroughly.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. ZHANG's course materials are well-prepared. Basically all the questions in the final exam are covered in the course material. He also provides the recordings of the lecture which are useful for revision.
reviews.comment_grading: Since this is a PG course the average grading is relatively higher. Around 50% of all students can get A range. The evaluate criteria includes written assignments, programming project/assignments, and a final exam. Students can choose from complete a group project or finish multiple programming assignments. The written assignments are not very hard and the contents are covered in the course material.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is reasonable. All the homework are not very time-consuming. If you have experience in writing research papers, the programming assignment should not be very challenging since there are many existing code online that can be reused and modified.

reviews.author: ust_pg
reviews.comment_content: The course contents are nicely designed, covering both theoretical foundations and high-level ideas. The focus of the course is on deep learning techniques such as CNN, RNN, Transformer, VAE, and GAN, as opposed to traditional machine learning algorithms. Brief introductions to algorithms in recent papers are also provided for each topic. It is recommended that students have some basic knowledge of machine learning before taking this course as many topics are covered. The course provides helpful tutorials that teach about programming and hands-on homework. Programming homework gives students the skeleton code, so students know where to start.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Zhang is an excellent teacher who provides wonderful intuitions in this course. He delivers the core concepts in more detail and uses a tablet to write notes, which is helpful for students to follow. The course also utilizes Piazza to facilitate question-asking. In addition, the TAs also provide great support to the students. Overall, the course is well-organized and provides a great learning experience.
reviews.comment_grading: The final grade for the course is determined by the final exam, which accounts for 50% of the total score, homework, which accounts for 20%, and the project, which accounts for 30%. For the project, students have the option to complete multiple programming assignments or work on a team project related to their chosen topic. The final exam is a reflection of the amount of effort put into the course.
reviews.comment_workload: Completing the homework and project assignments for this course can cost quite some time, but the good thing is that you can learn from the well-designed materials. The most time-consuming aspect of the course is reviewing the class materials because of the packed course contents.

reviews.author: moonlightstar
reviews.title: A useful and exciting machine learning course to take!
reviews.comment_content: Course are useful, well prepared, and could be considered as complete deep introductory materials to provide mathematical and implementation know-how of fundamental progression in machine learning.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Zhang explained the materials very well. His knowledge is so deep and he went as far as giving an accurate analogy to illustrate his point, and make sure that his points are delivered well to the students.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is generous. 50% will get an A range, and 90% will get a minimum B, I think, but the Prof notes that we are working hard also for other things, so he tries not to make us worried too much about the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: HWs and HAs can be too much for people without basic math and Python, but I reckon the workload is still doable even for people with such conditions. I didn't take the project path, so I can't comment on that.

reviews.author: Vayne
reviews.comment_content:
Well Organized, up-to-date content. Nevin updated the content every year actually.

Little programming thing is involved in the lecture; most of the things are about the theory side (but useful).
reviews.comment_teaching: Clear enough; easy to follow with a lot of handwriting maths.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair enough for most students. Not difficult to get an A for a PG student.
reviews.comment_workload:
Okay for me. But some students complain the workload is too high with the writing assignments, program assignments, the project, and the final exam.

The questions in the final exam are similar to those in the writing assignment.

reviews.author: yyj
reviews.title: Review
reviews.comment_content: The course covers basic concepts of machine learning. The contents are easy to follow and useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor and TA are good at teaching and their delivery is really nice.
reviews.comment_grading: The professor is very generous. It's easy to get B+ as long as you follow the workload and your exam score is not too low.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too light, but not too heavy. Assignments and final exam are not too hard while the project is quite time consuming and hard to get a great score.

reviews.author: CatherineChen
reviews.comment_content: Covered many basic aspects of ML, from basic calculations such as backwardpropagation and gradient descent to specific structures such as CNN, LSTM, GAN.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nevin is really a good lecturer. He prepared slides carefully, maintained a good pace in class, and answered questions in time.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading seems good as far as I am concerned.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much. Written assignments are basic, if you follow the lectures. You need to work on a group project, but you can choose virtually any topic related to ML. Final exam is not so hard, either.

reviews.author: hap
reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment_content:
The topic includes basic machine learning concepts, linear regression, generalization, RL concepts, generative models, unsupervised learning, etc.

The lecture discusses mostly about theory and the intuition of the machine learning concepts. It is okay to not fully memorize the technical details as long as you understand the intuition.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Nevin explains the concepts well although sometimes I find it lacking and not clear (maybe due to accent issues).
reviews.comment_grading: I thin the grading is okay. Most students can get an A based from the other students I asked.
reviews.comment_workload:
If you have experience with coding, then the workload can be good. The other questions in the homework about ML concepts can be easily answered.

In order to have good result in the exam, it is important to undestand the intution of the concepts.

reviews.author: Leric
reviews.title: Vert great
reviews.comment_content: The content is very useful I think. It is fundamental for all PG students, not only people who work in the machine learning area.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nevin Zhang teaches very clearly on both the overall picture and the details. I like him very much.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade, easy to get A or above even for me. I think if you want to promote your GPA, then you should absolutely choose this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Very little workload. It is easy to finish the homework and projects. If you do not want to cost too much time, please choose this.

reviews.author: allinmonster
reviews.comment_content: I took this course in UG. I would say that this course is the same as what I took. This course will help the student to understand the basic concepts of  machine learning and deep learning. It is very fun to take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor Nevin L Zhang is nice and give his point accurately;
However, the handwriting is hard to recognize.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading includes 4 assignments and the mid/final exam.
This course only touches on the basics of neural networks-based computer vision. 90% of student can get B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not very high. Totally can handle it. No mid-term, only project and final exam.
